Posts.Content: Sentinel lymph node affected so had LN clearance on 17 Jan. - no others positive. I am thinking belt and braces! Thanks
Posts.Title: Should I or Should I not have Chemotherapy?

Posts.Content: Thanks think I am going to be heading for chemo.........The posts here have been very useful. X
Posts.Title: Should I or Should I not have Chemotherapy?

Posts.Content: Thanks think it's got to be chemo. X
Posts.Title: Should I or Should I not have Chemotherapy?

Posts.Content: Hi  Thanks for your comments. I guess it's fear of side effects especially the long term ones. I am grade 1 invasive ductal carcinoma, hormone receptive and sentinal ymph node positive so had lymph node clearance on 17 Jan.  I had a masectomy on 13th December with expander implant reconstruction.   I am fit and healthy and recovered quick from both ops so hope if I decide on chemo being fit and keeping fit will get me through it. Good to hear you got on with life through it.
Posts.Title: Should I or Should I not have Chemotherapy?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone - I am in turmoil whether to have Chemo or not.  I have had the Oncotye DX test and results are 26 - slap bang in the middle of should I or shouldn't I have chemo? Met with oncologist last week and she has sent me away to discuss with friends and family - I am a week down the line and still don't know what to do, I meet with her again on 6th March with my decision. Anybody else in this situation at the moment?  If so have you decided which way to go? thanks
Posts.Title: Should I or Should I not have Chemotherapy?

Posts.Content: Hi Thanks I can't find anything on line but will ring macmillan tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Should I or Should I not have Chemotherapy?

Posts.Content: Thanks Carolyn interesting reading. It is the long term side effects of chemo that worry me. On initial diagnosis I had 2 areas of ductal cancer so opted for masectomy - the final pathology was 4 grade 1 cancers measuring 2,4,5 and 16 mm.  Thanks again.
Posts.Title: Should I or Should I not have Chemotherapy?

Posts.Content: Thanks think I will have it xx
Posts.Title: Should I or Should I not have Chemotherapy?

Posts.Content: Hi - I am waiting for my operation to have my breast expander exchanged to a silicon implant, however I am worried about the cancer risk from silicon implants - Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma. Has anybody had this worry? Believe it is a small risk but don't want any risks!! Interested to hear anyone's comments. Thanks
Posts.Title: Silicon Implants
